pullRequest.body:
Notably, `NormedSpace.to_uniformContinuousConstSMul` is generalized to `BoundedSMul` on `PseudoMetricSpace`s, relaxing the scalar considerably from normed fields.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

|<details><summary>7 files</summary> `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Uniform` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.SemiNormedGrp` `Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Valued.NormedValued` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.BallSphere` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Operator.LinearIsometry` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Operator.ContinuousLinearMap` `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Hom`</details>|3|

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance (priority := 100) BoundedSMul.toUniformContinuousConstSMul :`
`+ instance [NormedField ùïú] [SeminormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ùïú E] :`
`+ instance [NormedField ùïú] [SeminormedCommRing A] [NormedAlgebra ùïú A] :`
`+ instance [SeminormedCommRing A] : NormedCommRing (Completion A)`
`+ instance {M} [Zero M] [Zero Œ±] [SMul M Œ±] [PseudoMetricSpace M] [BoundedSMul M Œ±] :`
`- instance (priority := 100) NormedSpace.to_uniformContinuousConstSMul :`
`- instance : NormedSpace ùïú (Completion E)`
`- instance [SeminormedCommRing A] [NormedAlgebra ùïú A] [UniformContinuousConstSMul ùïú A] :`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: eric-wieser can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11043095961/job/30676750114)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11043095961/job/30676749938)
This proof was a duplicate of one in another file.
Apparently this result is really fun to reprove for a third time.
This `have` started specializing to `PUnit.{0}`, which broke the `rw` below. Inlining into the `rw` to force contextual unification seems to do the trick.
the bare `instance` line bugs me stylistically. Care to reformat?
Would you be happy with `instance instNormedAlgebra`?
It turns out that this last argument was redundant anyway.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: generalize normed instances on `UniformSpace.Completion`
